const books = [{
  id: 1,
  title: "Practices of an Agile Developer",
  author: "Venkat Subramaniam, Andy Hunt",
  publisher: "Pragmatic Bookshelf",
  date: "2006",
  cover: "https://pragprog.com/titles/pad/practices-of-an-agile-developer/pad_hu_d762789e56fd66b1.jpg",
  rating: 4.6,
  reviews: 125,
  mainCategory: "Technical",
  subCategory: "Software Development",
  description: "A practical guide to adopting agile principles in real-world projects. Covers communication, testing, refactoring, and iterative improvement to build flexible, high-quality software."
}, {
  id: 2,
  title: "Developer Testing",
  author: "Alexander Tarlinder",
  publisher: "Addison-Wesley Professional",
  date: "2016",
  cover: "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/5192r17OZHL._SY445_SX342_.jpg",
  rating: 4.5,
  reviews: 98,
  mainCategory: "Technical",
  subCategory: "Testing",
  description: "Explains how to think about testing as a developer. Includes techniques for writing better test cases, building testable code, and ensuring robust software delivery."
}, {
  id: 3,
  title: "JavaScript: The Definitive Guide",
  author: "David Flanagan",
  publisher: "O'Reilly Media",
  date: "2020",
  cover: "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/71qA0bT4NfL._AC_UF1000,1000_QL80_.jpg",
  rating: 4.8,
  reviews: 205,
  mainCategory: "Technical",
  subCategory: "Programming",
  description: "The ultimate reference for JavaScript developers. Covers ES6+ features, asynchronous programming, and browser APIs in detail for professional front-end engineers."
}, {
  id: 4,
  title: "Eloquent JavaScript",
  author: "Marijn Haverbeke",
  publisher: "No Starch Press",
  date: "2018",
  cover: "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/91asIC1fRwL.jpg",
  rating: 4.7,
  reviews: 176,
  mainCategory: "Technical",
  subCategory: "Programming",
  description: "A beautifully written introduction to JavaScript and programming concepts. Explains everything from basics to advanced concepts using hands-on examples and projects."
}, {
  id: 5,
  title: "Clean Code",
  author: "Robert C. Martin",
  publisher: "Prentice Hall",
  date: "2008",
  cover: "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41xShlnTZTL._SX374_BO1,204,203,200_.jpg",
  rating: 4.9,
  reviews: 300,
  mainCategory: "Technical",
  subCategory: "Best Practices",
  description: "A must-read for all developers. Teaches how to write clean, readable, and maintainable code. Includes real-world examples of good and bad code practices."
}, {
  id: 6,
  title: "Rich Dad Poor Dad",
  author: "Robert T. Kiyosaki",
  publisher: "Warner Books",
  date: "1997",
  cover: "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/81bsw6fnUiL.jpg",
  rating: 4.4,
  reviews: 550,
  mainCategory: "Self Motivation",
  subCategory: "Finance & Success",
  description: "A personal finance classic that challenges traditional beliefs about money and investing. Explains how to achieve financial freedom through assets and entrepreneurship."
}, {
  id: 7,
  title: "The Great Gatsby",
  author: "F. Scott Fitzgerald",
  publisher: "Charles Scribner’s Sons",
  date: "1925",
  cover: "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/81af+MCATTL.jpg",
  rating: 4.2,
  reviews: 480,
  mainCategory: "Classic Literature",
  subCategory: "Drama",
  description: "A story of love, wealth, and tragedy set in the roaring twenties. Jay Gatsby’s pursuit of the American dream is both inspiring and heartbreaking."
}, {
  id: 8,
  title: "The Hobbit",
  author: "J.R.R. Tolkien",
  publisher: "George Allen & Unwin",
  date: "1937",
  cover: "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/91b0C2YNSrL.jpg",
  rating: 4.9,
  reviews: 950,
  mainCategory: "Fantasy",
  subCategory: "Adventure",
  description: "An adventurous tale about Bilbo Baggins’ unexpected journey through Middle-earth. A timeless story of courage, friendship, and discovery."
}, {
  id: 9,
  title: "India That Is Bharat",
  author: "J Sai Deepak",
  publisher: "Bloomsbury India",
  date: "2021",
  cover: "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/81XxQWLzQUL._SY466_.jpg",
  rating: 4.5,
  reviews: 320,
  mainCategory: "Non-Fiction",
  subCategory: "Socio-Political",
  description: "A thought-provoking book exploring India's postcolonial identity and civilizational perspective. Blends law, history, and philosophy in a powerful narrative."
}, {
  id: 10,
  title: "Atomic Habits",
  author: "James Clear",
  publisher: "Penguin Random House",
  date: "2018",
  cover: "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/91bYsX41DVL.jpg",
  rating: 4.8,
  reviews: 1200,
  mainCategory: "Self Motivation",
  subCategory: "Personal Growth",
  description: "A science-backed guide to building better habits and breaking bad ones. Explains how small daily improvements lead to massive long-term growth."
}];
export default books;

sourcesContent:
const books = [
  {
    id: 1,
    title: "Practices of an Agile Developer",
    author: "Venkat Subramaniam, Andy Hunt",
    publisher: "Pragmatic Bookshelf",
    date: "2006",
    cover:
      "https://pragprog.com/titles/pad/practices-of-an-agile-developer/pad_hu_d762789e56fd66b1.jpg",
    rating: 4.6,
    reviews: 125,
    mainCategory: "Technical",
    subCategory: "Software Development",
    description:
      "A practical guide to adopting agile principles in real-world projects. Covers communication, testing, refactoring, and iterative improvement to build flexible, high-quality software."
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    title: "Developer Testing",
    author: "Alexander Tarlinder",
    publisher: "Addison-Wesley Professional",
    date: "2016",
    cover:
      "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/5192r17OZHL._SY445_SX342_.jpg",
    rating: 4.5,
    reviews: 98,
    mainCategory: "Technical",
    subCategory: "Testing",
    description:
      "Explains how to think about testing as a developer. Includes techniques for writing better test cases, building testable code, and ensuring robust software delivery."
  },
  {
    id: 3,
    title: "JavaScript: The Definitive Guide",
    author: "David Flanagan",
    publisher: "O'Reilly Media",
    date: "2020",
    cover:
      "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/71qA0bT4NfL._AC_UF1000,1000_QL80_.jpg",
    rating: 4.8,
    reviews: 205,
    mainCategory: "Technical",
    subCategory: "Programming",
    description:
      "The ultimate reference for JavaScript developers. Covers ES6+ features, asynchronous programming, and browser APIs in detail for professional front-end engineers."
  },
  {
    id: 4,
    title: "Eloquent JavaScript",
    author: "Marijn Haverbeke",
    publisher: "No Starch Press",
    date: "2018",
    cover:
      "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/91asIC1fRwL.jpg",
    rating: 4.7,
    reviews: 176,
    mainCategory: "Technical",
    subCategory: "Programming",
    description:
      "A beautifully written introduction to JavaScript and programming concepts. Explains everything from basics to advanced concepts using hands-on examples and projects."
  },
  {
    id: 5,
    title: "Clean Code",
    author: "Robert C. Martin",
    publisher: "Prentice Hall",
    date: "2008",
    cover:
      "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41xShlnTZTL._SX374_BO1,204,203,200_.jpg",
    rating: 4.9,
    reviews: 300,
    mainCategory: "Technical",
    subCategory: "Best Practices",
    description:
      "A must-read for all developers. Teaches how to write clean, readable, and maintainable code. Includes real-world examples of good and bad code practices."
  },
  {
    id: 6,
    title: "Rich Dad Poor Dad",
    author: "Robert T. Kiyosaki",
    publisher: "Warner Books",
    date: "1997",
    cover:
      "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/81bsw6fnUiL.jpg",
    rating: 4.4,
    reviews: 550,
    mainCategory: "Self Motivation",
    subCategory: "Finance & Success",
    description:
      "A personal finance classic that challenges traditional beliefs about money and investing. Explains how to achieve financial freedom through assets and entrepreneurship."
  },
  {
    id: 7,
    title: "The Great Gatsby",
    author: "F. Scott Fitzgerald",
    publisher: "Charles Scribner’s Sons",
    date: "1925",
    cover:
      "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/81af+MCATTL.jpg",
    rating: 4.2,
    reviews: 480,
    mainCategory: "Classic Literature",
    subCategory: "Drama",
    description:
      "A story of love, wealth, and tragedy set in the roaring twenties. Jay Gatsby’s pursuit of the American dream is both inspiring and heartbreaking."
  },
  {
    id: 8,
    title: "The Hobbit",
    author: "J.R.R. Tolkien",
    publisher: "George Allen & Unwin",
    date: "1937",
    cover:
      "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/91b0C2YNSrL.jpg",
    rating: 4.9,
    reviews: 950,
    mainCategory: "Fantasy",
    subCategory: "Adventure",
    description:
      "An adventurous tale about Bilbo Baggins’ unexpected journey through Middle-earth. A timeless story of courage, friendship, and discovery."
  },
  {
    id: 9,
    title: "India That Is Bharat",
    author: "J Sai Deepak",
    publisher: "Bloomsbury India",
    date: "2021",
    cover:
      "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/81XxQWLzQUL._SY466_.jpg",
    rating: 4.5,
    reviews: 320,
    mainCategory: "Non-Fiction",
    subCategory: "Socio-Political",
    description:
      "A thought-provoking book exploring India's postcolonial identity and civilizational perspective. Blends law, history, and philosophy in a powerful narrative."
  },
  {
    id: 10,
    title: "Atomic Habits",
    author: "James Clear",
    publisher: "Penguin Random House",
    date: "2018",
    cover:
      "https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/91bYsX41DVL.jpg",
    rating: 4.8,
    reviews: 1200,
    mainCategory: "Self Motivation",
    subCategory: "Personal Growth",
    description:
      "A science-backed guide to building better habits and breaking bad ones. Explains how small daily improvements lead to massive long-term growth."
  }
];

export default books;
